description: Default Bayesian priors for Process Triage inference engine. These priors encode domain knowledge about process behavior patterns and are designed for typical development machines.

cpu_beta._comment: Useful processes typically have moderate CPU usage. Mean = 0.29

runtime_gamma._comment: Long-lived is normal for useful processes. Mean = 20000 seconds (~5.5 hours)

orphan_beta._comment: Useful processes are rarely orphaned. P(orphan) ~ 0.05

tty_beta._comment: Useful processes often have TTY attachment. P(TTY) ~ 0.625

io_active_beta._comment: Useful processes typically have I/O activity. P(IO) ~ 0.625

hazard_gamma._comment: Very low base hazard rate. Mean hazard = 0.00001/sec

cpu_beta._comment: Useful-but-bad processes often have high CPU. Mean = 0.80

runtime_gamma._comment: Moderate runtime expected. Mean = 15000 seconds (~4 hours)

orphan_beta._comment: Somewhat more likely to be orphaned. P(orphan) ~ 0.20

tty_beta._comment: Less likely to have TTY. P(TTY) ~ 0.375

io_active_beta._comment: Often have high I/O (resource hog). P(IO) ~ 0.75

cpu_beta._comment: Abandoned processes typically have very low CPU. Mean = 0.09

runtime_gamma._comment: Often long-running (been abandoned for a while). Mean = 80000 seconds (~22 hours)

orphan_beta._comment: Abandoned processes are very often orphaned. P(orphan) ~ 0.80

tty_beta._comment: Abandoned processes rarely have TTY. P(TTY) ~ 0.09

hazard_gamma._comment: Higher hazard (should have finished by now). Mean = 0.00015/sec

orphan_beta._comment: Zombies are almost always orphaned/reparented. P(orphan) ~ 0.94

net_beta._comment: Zombies have no network activity. P(net) ~ 0.01

hazard_gamma._comment: Should be reaped quickly but often aren't. Mean = 0.0005/sec

hazard_regimes.name: tty_lost
hazard_regimes.description: Process lost its controlling TTY (terminal closed, SSH disconnected)

gamma._comment: Elevated hazard after TTY loss. Mean = 0.000556/sec (~1.5 events/hour)

hazard_regimes.name: ppid_orphaned
hazard_regimes.description: Process was reparented to init (PPID=1) indicating parent died

hazard_regimes.name: io_flatline
hazard_regimes.description: Process has had zero I/O activity for extended period

hazard_regimes.name: cpu_spinloop
hazard_regimes.description: Process showing high CPU with no progress (suspected infinite loop)

gamma._comment: High CPU + no IO = likely stuck. Mean = 0.00208/sec

useful_duration._comment: Expected time in 'useful' state: ~5.5 hours mean

useful_bad_duration._comment: Expected time in 'useful_bad' state: ~1.4 hours mean

abandoned_duration._comment: Abandoned processes can persist long: ~5.5 hours mean

zombie_duration._comment: Zombies should be reaped quickly: ~8 minutes mean

p_before._comment: Symmetric prior for activity rate before change: mean = 0.5

p_after._comment: After change, expect lower activity: mean = 0.2

change_point._comment: Prior on change-point location: expected run length ~1000 samples

useful._comment: Kill is wrong for useful: P(recover) ~ 0.06

abandoned._comment: Kill is right for abandoned: P(recover) ~ 0.9

zombie._comment: Kill is right for zombie: P(recover) ~ 0.8

command_categories._comment: Dirichlet alpha vectors: higher values = more expected for that class

hierarchical._comment: Apply 30% shrinkage toward global priors for category-specific estimates

robust_bayes._comment: Imprecise prior bounds for robust/credal decision making

false_kill._comment: Prior belief: false-kill rate is low (~1%). Beta(1,99) mean = 0.01

false_spare._comment: Prior belief: false-spare rate is moderate (~5%). Beta(5,95) mean = 0.05

bocpd._comment: Expected run length = 1000 samples before change; require 10+ samples for detection
